page.title: 04FARMING - LET AND PRIVATE
page.content: There are 23 let farms varying in size up to 500 acres on the Englefield Estate. Some of these are in this area. Dairying and cereals are the main enterprises, but there are also 3 flocks of sheep and a number of pig herds. Wickcroft Farm and part of Bournfield Farm are examples of such let property. In this area there are several farms which are privately owned. Malpas Farm has 80,000 chickens producing 63,500 eggs per day. These are packed and distributed from Three Mile Cross. The owner of Hewinswood Farm works alone raising 2,000 pigs for pork. Barn Elms is a mixed farm growing wheat, barley, corriander, calabrese and potatoes as well as 99 beef cattle. These are examples of activities undertaken by private farmers.
